description: Assembles a 3D dataset from an ASCII list of coordinates and optionally values.

input_files.title: Input file(s)
input_files.description: Input ASCII file(s), with one voxel specification per line.

prefix.title: Output prefix
prefix.description: 'ppp' is the prefix for the output dataset [default = undump].

master.title: Master dataset
master.description: 'mmm' is the master dataset, whose geometry will determine the geometry of the output.

dimensions.title: Dimensions
dimensions.description: Sets the dimensions of the output dataset to be I by J by K voxels.

mask.title: Mask dataset
mask.description: Specifies a mask dataset 'MMM', which will control which voxels are allowed to get values set.

datatype.title: Data type
datatype.description: 'type' determines the voxel data type of the output, which may be byte, short, or float [default = short].

dval.title: Default voxel value
dval.description: 'vvv' is the default value stored in each input voxel that does not have a value supplied in the input file [default = 1].

fval.title: Fill value
fval.description: 'fff' is the fill value, used for each voxel in the output dataset that is NOT listed in the input file [default = 0].

ijk.title: IJK coordinates
ijk.description: Coordinates in the input file are (i,j,k) index triples.

xyz.title: XYZ coordinates
xyz.description: Coordinates in the input file are (x,y,z) spatial coordinates, in mm.

sphere_radius.title: Sphere radius
sphere_radius.description: Specifies that a sphere of radius 'rrr' will be filled about each input (x,y,z) or (i,j,k) voxel.

cube_mode.title: Cube mode
cube_mode.description: Put cubes down instead of spheres. The 'radius' then is half the length of a side.

orient.title: Orientation code
orient.description: Specifies the coordinate order used by -xyz. The code must be 3 letters, one each from the pairs {R,L} {A,P} {I,S}.

roimask.title: ROI mask
roimask.description: Specifies which voxels get what numbers by using a dataset 'rrr', instead of coordinates.

allow_nan.title: Allow NaNs
allow_nan.description: Allow NaN (not-a-number) values to be entered.
